text: Tap at Fermentoren, Copenhagen.  Poured a cloudy amber with a thin white head. The aroma is big malty with a little citrus, leading to a smooth, dry taste which is slightly bitter. The palate is smooth, but lacking flavour.
On tap @ Fermentoren. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Lightly hopped aroma. Taste to match

CBC.
Tap, 110512.
Yellow with white head. Aroma of citrus and hay. Flavour with malt and spices.
Pours dark amber with a dense beige head. Aroma is caramel, grapefruit and citrus. Flavour follows the nose. Medium bitter.

Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration, 2012. Hazy dark amber with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, little caramel and a little citrus. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, grass, grainy, little sweet and bitter.

Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration. Pours golden with a small white head. Aroma of malt, sweet fruit, grassy and citrusly hops. Taste is malt, fruity, grass, citrus, light pine. Medium body, soft carbonation, btter finish. 110512
Draft. Deep amber color, bright white head, solid lacing. Aroma of bright pine and grass. Taste is bitter pine resin and very sour lemons.

Draft at CBC.  Pours hazy amber with a white head.  Aroma is fruity, some orange, grass and citrus.  Flavour is grassy and fruity but has a nice caramel balance.  Medium bodied with light carbonation.

Tap at Fermentoren. Pours a low haze amber with medium carbonation. Webby lace. Rocky retention. Thick, creamy foam. Sticky candy nose, cherry juicy juice, strawberries. I dont think this brewery knows what beta acid hops are. Taste is bread, oversteeped lemon tea, oversteeped hotel coffee, mallic/tartaric acid. Palate is soapy and astringent. Tannic, husky. All of this brewerys beers have the same brew flaws. Need total recipe reworkings.
Draught. Orange with a small off white head. Very citrusy aroma - hints of grass, grain, caramel. Nice malty sweetness and refshing bitter finish. Very un-heavy, very much one to guzzle.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Copenhagen.
Pours a copper amber colour with a small lacy head. Aroma of strong floral hops, grass and some citrusy notes. Flavour of pale malts, floral hops, grass and biscuit. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and a rough, malty and bitter finish. Tasty stuff.

Draught @ Fermentoren.
Pours hazy copper color with small head. Aroma of
grassy hops, apricot, lemon, mandarin and orange
peel. Flavour of fruits, grass, caramel and some
resin. Quite nice brew actually, crisp and
refreshing.
3515

Draught @ Fermentoren
Rather light aroma with some grainy malt and grassy hops. Also hints of butter. Flavour has grassy hops and some grainy malt. A bit short flavour. Refreshing and hoppy stuff.

Draught at Fermentoren, CopenhagenCloudy copper color, creamy head. It has a very nice, fresh, fruity aroma; apricot jam and mango; followed later by a yeasty and manure touch. Lean and drinkable body, with a good malt caramel and toffee flavor; the malts provide a light residual sweetness, and the hops a certain resiny and fruity touch; but I find the bitterness exaggerated, therefore creating an unbalancing effect. In the end it gets difficult to stand in big quantities, although its a very good beer.Rough.

Tap @ Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Hazy dark amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - fruity and a hint of elderflower. Flavor is medium sweet and rather bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 270412
Tap at Fermentoren. Unclear amber colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of citrus, malt, hops and yeast.

On tap at Christian Firtal. Hazy amber with a lasting white head. Fruity aroma with orange peel character, and a bit of bready malt. Sweetish fruity flavour with orange and lemon peel, and a firm and lasting bitter finish
Tap @ C4, Odense. Pours cloudy ruby amber with a creamy head and lacings. Fresh cascade. A bit of yeast and caramel. Dry, crisp and bitter Flavor. Smooth.

Draft @ Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Pours a clear amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity citrus hoppy aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter citrus flavor. Had a fruity malty hoppy bitter fresh citrus finish.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Halmtorvet 29 c, Copenhagen, Denmark 1700.Unclear - hazy matt medium orange colour with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, caramel, light to moderate hoppy, crispy hop, grass. Initial flavour is moderate sweet and bitter, finish flavor is moderate sweet and moderte to heavy with a long to average duration, malt acrid bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120202]

Choop. No more Centennial or low amounts and very expensive.. so Cascade instead. Nice hazy deep orange colour with a white small in size head, good lacing. Pleasant fruity citrus hoppy aroma. Good mouthfeel. Flavour is fresh and hoppy with fruit and citrus along with some pine too, ok sweetness, good bitterness.

Draught at Fermentoren.
Hazy orange coloured with a medium sized off-white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, pine needles and grass.
Fruity flavour of hops and grape fruits with notes of citrus peel.
Dry hoppy finish.

Draft. A hazy dark amber beer with a thick off-white head. The aroma has notes of citrus fruits, hops, as well as some malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemons, grass, spices, malt, and caramel, leading to a bitter finish.

From tap at Fermentoren. Pours hazy orange with a small, creamy and white head. Aroma is crisp hoppy, grassy and citrusy. Crips bitter, fruity, peachy and solid grapefruity. Smooth fruity, crisp bitter and citrusy finish.
On tap. Pours an opaque amber with a dense off-white head. Dry and flowery hop aroma. Medium body, fruit and a little caramel. Dry and bitter finish - somewhat dusty and herbal. 280112
tap  at fermentoren.  clear dark orange, smooth offwhite head. Aroma is mild hoppy, malty. Flavor is malty, hoppy, a little grapefruit  and pine
Draught at Fermentoren. Cloudy amber/brown - white head. Nice pleasant hoppy. Grassy. Light piney notes. Toasted. Light bisquit. Fresh bitterness. Light malty sweetness. Citrus. Nice bitter finish.
